message.content:
<<<api>>>: java.awt.image.BufferedImage
<<<code>>>: 
BufferedImage image = ImageIO.read(new File("image.jpg"));
File output = new File("compressed_image.jpg");
OutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(output);

JPEGImageWriter writer = (JPEGImageWriter) ImageIO.getImageWritersBySuffix("jpeg").next();
ImageOutputStream ios = ImageIO.createImageOutputStream(out);
writer.setOutput(ios);

JPEGImageWriteParam jpegParams = (JPEGImageWriteParam) writer.getDefaultWriteParam();
jpegParams.setCompressionMode(JPEGImageWriteParam.MODE_EXPLICIT);
jpegParams.setCompressionQuality(0.5f);

writer.write(null, new IIOImage(image, null, null), jpegParams);

out.close();
ios.close();
writer.dispose();
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads an image from a file, then compresses it by setting the compression quality to 0.5 (50%) and writes the compressed image to a new file. The JPEGImageWriter and JPEGImageWriteParam classes are used to set the compression parameters. The compression quality can be adjusted to a value between 0.0f and 1.0f, where 1.0f means no compression (highest quality) and 0.0f means maximum compression (lowest quality).
